headline: AMAT vs. ASML: Which Semiconductor Equipment Stock is a Better Buy?
summary: Applied Materials' expanding HBM, NAND and advanced packaging tools contrast with ASML Holding's EUV-led shift in semiconductor patterning.

headline: [Latest] Global Thin-film Electrode Market Size/Share Worth USD 1,595.3 Million by 2035 at a 11.8% CAGR: Custom Market Insights (Analysis, Outlook, Leaders, Report, Trends, Forecast, Segmentation, Growth Rate, Value, SWOT Analysis)

headline: Q3 Rundown: Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) Vs Other Semiconductor Manufacturing Stocks
summary: Earnings results often indicate what direction a company will take in the months ahead. With Q3 behind us, let’s have a look at Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) and its peers.

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider Applied Materials (AMAT) After A 72% One Year Surge?
summary: If you are wondering whether Applied Materials at around US$327 per share still offers value, you are not alone. The stock has drawn a lot of attention from investors asking if the current price fairly reflects its long term prospects. The share price has moved to US$327.01, with returns of 6.4% over the past week, 27.5% over the last 30 days, 21.6% year to date and 72.0% over the past year. Three year and five year returns sit at 194.3% and 215.8% respectively. Recent news around Applied...
